intro: Antagonia citrullifolia, commonly known as the false cucumber, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces striking yellow or orange flowers that are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a fibrous, spiny capsule that contains several seeds. Antagonia citrullifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
